privex.pyrewall.core.columnize(items, displaywidth=80)[source]¶

Display a items of strings as a compact set of columns.

Each column is only as wide as necessary. Columns are separated by two spaces (one was not legible enough).

privex.pyrewall.core.find_file(filename: str, paths: List[str] = None, extensions=None) → str[source]¶

Attempt to find a file in a given list of paths

Usage:

>>> find_file('test')
/etc/pyrewall/test.pyre
>>> find_file('example.v4', paths=['/etc', '/etc/test'], extensions=[''])
/etc/example.v4
Parameters

  • filename (str) – A filename, relative path, or absolute file path

  • paths (List[str]) – A list of paths to search for filename within

  • extensions (List[str]) – A list of filename extensions to try suffixing if the exact name can’t be found

Raises

FileNotFoundError – When the filename could not be found in any of the given paths or with extensions.

Return str path

If the file was found, returns an absolute path to the matched file

privex.pyrewall.core.valid_port(port: Union[str, int]) → int[source]¶

Returns the integer port if it’s valid. Otherwise raises InvalidPort
